title: Low Content Publishing Keyword Research Strategies

tactics.name: Keyword Back-End Stuffing
tactics.description: Fill back-end keywords with as many relevant terms as possible to maximize indexing opportunities
steps: Find a niche on Amazon (e.g., recipe books, journals)
Use generic keywords in first 4 boxes (e.g., 'blank recipe book')
Add specific keywords in last 2-3 boxes (e.g., 'let it go journal')
source_quotes: you don't have to put just one key word blank family recipe book and then stop there and then put another one here you can actually fill this up as much as you can

tactics.name: Amazon Suggestion Expander
tactics.description: Uses Amazon's keyword suggestion tools to generate longtail keywords and identify niche opportunities
steps: Type base keyword into Amazon search bar
Use suggestion tool to expand keywords
Check BSR and review counts for competitiveness
caveats: May not show niche keywords with low search volume
source_quotes: this can give you other ideas and other longtail keywords

tactics.name: low_competition_niche_hunting
tactics.description: Identify niches with minimal competition by checking search results and review counts
steps: Prioritize keywords with low competition and moderate review counts
caveats: Avoid niches with no sales data even if low competition
source_quotes: there was only 587 results... not competitive
I would stay away from this one

heuristics.name: Review Count Threshold
source_quotes: I will show you those things as well but for the most part the first some a couple of the strategies are the same

heuristics.name: Low Competition Filter
heuristics.condition: If keyword has under 200 reviews and BSR over 50,000, then prioritize
source_quotes: I look for things that are under a million

heuristics.name: review_based_niche_selection
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize the niche
source_quotes: I would try this one because there are a couple right at that cusp of a million

claims.statement: KDP indexes books for every keyword entered in back-end keywords
source_quotes: your book will get an index for every key word you put in here

claims.statement: Longtail keywords can have high search volume but may lack niche specificity
source_quotes: this one actually surprisingly even though it's a longtail keyword it actually has 40,000 results

claims.statement: Tools like Publisher Rocket and Book Bolt can accelerate keyword research
source_quotes: I use Publisher Rocket and Book Bolt as well

niche_patterns.description: Target underserved niches with low competition by combining identity, problem, and constraint
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Captures specific audience needs with minimal saturation
source_quotes: I find a topic either on amazon or a hobby list and I'm gonna demo and show you all this in a in a minute or two

niche_patterns.description: Combines specific hobbies with specialized content formats
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Reduces competition while maintaining search volume
source_quotes: take some more obscure things like Aero modeling amateur astronomy
